name: Flora
intro: Flora is the third EP released by Portland-based rock band [[artists/Helens|Helens]].

name: Pollen
intro: Pollen is the second EP released by Portland-based rock band [[artists/Helens|Helens]].

name: Somewhere in Nowhere
intro: Somewhere in Nowhere is the first full-length album release by Portland-based rock band [[artists/Helens|Helens]].

name: Teeth
intro: Teeth is the first EP released by Portland-based rock band [[artists/Helens|Helens]].

name: Follow the Cyborg
intro: Follow the Cyborg is the debut album from New York-based artist [[artists/Miss Grit|Miss Grit]].
about: Follow the Cyborg explores gender, cybernetics, and personal identity through quirky, deeply personal alt-rock.

name: BIG AND KIND
intro: BIG AND KIND is an album released by [[artists/NONBINARY-GIRLFRIEND|NONBINARY GIRLFRIEND]] on February 14, 2023.
about: BIG AND KIND's title track, and also the band's breakaway hit, is an exhortation to embrace bigness in relationship, to establish boundaries as a form of kindness. The song is catchy and sweet, and the song's central groove is very bedroom pop-y, though a punk aesthetic materializes as it develops. The band often straddles the apparently thin line between [[genres/Bedroom-pop | bedroom pop]] and [[genres/Punk | punk]] on the album.

name: Don't Hit Me Up
intro: Don't Hit Me Up is the debut album from Brooklyn-based [[artists/Raavi|Raavi]].

name: I Don't Like To Cry
intro: I Don't Like to Cry is an EP released by Salem, Oregon-based band [[artists/Sadgasm|Sadgasm]].
about: The EP sees the band employing surf rock motifs, especially in the drumming of the first 3 tracks.

name: Missouri
intro: Missouri is a 2023 single released by Salem, Oregon-based band [[artists/Sadgasm|Sadgasm]].

name: Ramen
intro: Ramen is the debut release from Salem, Oregon-based band [[artists/Sadgasm|Sadgasm]].
about: The first and last tracks on this album are likely Sadgasm's most well-known. The first, Cum On, illustrates the band's softer side. On the other hand, Car Crash employs yelled vocals reminiscent of some of the more raucous 2000s indie rock & emo groups.

name: To Tame a Wild Cowboy
intro: To Tame a Wild Cowboy is a 2022 album released by Salem, Oregon-based band [[artists/Sadgasm|Sadgasm]].
about: Tempos are a bit more upbeat on this album than previous releases from the band. The sound is a bit tidier and polished, but the room sound characteristic of the band's previous recordings is preserved.

intro: 1-5 is a single released by [[artists/scribble-t|scribble t]] on August 25, 2022.
about: 1-5 was released on Bandcamp as a single without a B side in August of 2022.

intro: 4-6 is a single released by [[artists/scribble-t|scribble t]] on November 25, 2022.
about: 4-6 was released on Bandcamp as a single without a B side in November of 2022.

name: They Grow Up So Fast
intro: They Grow Up So Fast is the debut single from Portland-based alt-punk outfit [[artists/combobox|combobox]].
about: A short, hard ska track - and a definitive combobox song. Recorded in the band member's various basements, the recording is less polished than their future singles would prove to be.

name: Meanwhile (Live at Coconut Monkey Studios)
intro: Meanwhile is the second single from Portland-based alt-punk outfit [[artists/combobox|combobox]].
about: Meanwhile is likely combobox's most well-known track. it couples absurdist storytelling with a groovy crankwave sound and an anthemic chorus reminiscent of [Gustaf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustaf_(band))'s hooks.

name: The Planets (Live at Coconut Monkey Studios)
intro: The Planets is the third single from Portland-based alt-punk band [[artists/combobox|combobox]].
about: The Planets is combobox at their most bombastic. Loud, propulsive drums coupled with a repetitive, aggressive motif keep the short track moving forward, and the rapid flow of spoken and yelled lyrics pithced against frenetic, jagged guitar parts provide for a track that is at once in-your-face and tongue-in-cheek.

name: Rotten Bun for an Eggless Century
intro: Rotten Bun for an Eggless Century is the debut solo album from [[artists/mui zyu|mui zyu]].
about: Melodically inventive, expansive, subtle - Rotten Bun for an Eggless Century is a ride. [[tracks/rotten bun|Rotten Bun]], the opening track, is a work of baroque [[genres/folktronica|folktronica]] with classical aspirations. Making use of minimal, subdued drum machines à la [[artists/jacob mann|Jacob Mann]], many of the album's tracks make use of [[genres/bedroom pop|bedroom pop]] sonorities without succumbing to all of the genre's trappings. At its most reserved, mui zyu's vocal stylings are similar to those of avant-pop luminary [Genevieve Artadi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genevieve_Artadi), as is her harmonic language.

name: a wonderful thing vomits
intro: a wonderful thing vomits is the debut EP from [[artists/mui zyu|mui zyu]].
about: Sitting on the experimental side of [[genres/bedroom pop|bedroom pop]], a wonderful thing vomits finds its joy in mashing together disparate harmonic and timbral ideas.

name: nothing or something to die for
intro: nothing or something to die for is the sophomore album from [[artists/mui zyu|mui zyu]].
about: nothing or something to die for begins the way [[releases/rotten bun for an eggless world|Rotten Bun for an Eggless World]] does - an opening track firmly invested in developing classical sonorities followed by something which pretends to be a somber indie romp. In this case, [[tracks/the mould|the mould]] (the second track of the album) is very strange in an exciting way. It is at its best when, listening to it, you realize for the first time that you have no idea where mui zyu is taking you. And this experience remains the album's strength - the various moments when you are taken somewhere even more striking than was promised at the onset of the each track.

name: Bass Tone Paintings
intro: Bass Tone Paintings is the debut album from [[artists/the growth eternal|The Growth Eternal]].
about: Bass Tone Paintings is a set of 17 distinct minute-long tracks which explore a variety of timbral and rhythmic ideas, both within and around [[artists/the growth eternal|ghalani]]'s bass playing. The album is a fun, rapid-fire exploration of modern [[genres/jazz|jazz]] & [[genres/soul|soul]] bass concepts, and is often gorgeous.

name: Kensho !
intro: Kensho ! is an EP from [[artists/the growth eternal|The Growth Eternal]].
about: Similar to [[tracks/bass tone paintings|Bass Tone Paintings]], Kensho ! is a set of short tracks through which [[artists/the growth eternal|ghalani]] explores disparate sound concepts within the [[genres/jazz|jazz]] & [[genres/soul|soul]] harmonic palettes. The recordings here are a bit more harmonically and timbrally adventurous than in Bass Tone Paintings.

name: PARASAiL-18
intro: PARASAiL-18 is the sophomore album from [[artists/the growth eternal|The Growth Eternal]].
about: Unlike their previous releases, PARASAiL-18 sees bassist and composer [[artists/the growth eternal|ghalani]] working at a much larger scale. Tracks are much longer, to be sure, but they are also developed more carefully, patiently. More samples and effects are employed, because there is far more space for them. ghalani's work is somewhat minimalist in nature, in the sense that orchestrations are often spare and change occurs slowly, but there is plenty to listen for, and the album usually rewards the patient listener. Several of the tracks are strikingly pretty.

name: Holocene Pyre
intro: Holocene Pyre is a single from [[artists/the growth eternal|The Growth Eternal]], which includes poetry written and spoken by Joy Harjo.
about: Across its seven and a half minutes, [[artists/the growth eternal|ghalani]] builds up a timbral palette of samples and synthesized sounds that provide a backgrounded sketch of nature and its destruction. Chanting from the 2020 climate march in LA can be heard, and the track closes with the poem "Let There Be No Regrets" by Joy Harjo. The overwhelming sentiment is one of grief. ghalani [describes the track as a "prayer."](https://thegrowtheternal.bandcamp.com/album/holocene-pyre-ft-joy-harjo).
